Forecast_Up_To.Description: It is likely to be clear sky for next four days and partly cloudy sky on sunday. The daily maximum temperature will remain 29.0°C-33.0°C. The daily minimum temperature will remain 11.0°C-13.0°C. The wind speed will remain 6.0-7.0 kmph. Humid conditions during the forenoon (45-82%) and during the afternoon (18-29%) may prevail.

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: If the nutrient deficiency symptoms (yellowing) and browning of leaf tips appear in rice nursery, apply foliar spray of mixed solution of 0.5% zinc sulphate + 2.5 % urea.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Cover the recently planted vegetable crops with paper pockets during night time to protect from low temperature.

RICE.Advisory: If the nutrient deficiency symptoms (yellowing) and browning of leaf tips appear in rice nursery, apply foliar spray of mixed solution of 0.5% zinc sulphate + 2.5 % urea.

PIGEON PEA (RED GRAM/ARHAR).Advisory: To avoid storage pests' infestation during storage smearing of seeds should be done with edible oil @ 250 ml/ Quintal of seeds. Dried leaves of either Begonia or Neem @ 1 kg/Bag should be kept inside the storage bag to minimize storage pest load. Camphor tablets @ 1-tablet/kg of seeds can also be kept inside the storage bag to avoid storage pests.

ONION.Advisory: Onion Seedlings of 8-weeks old which are 12-15 cm in height should be planted in the main field. Before transplanting apply 10 tonnes of Compost, 52 kg of DAP, 30 kg of Muriate of Potash, 20 kg of urea and 20 kg of sulphur and mix it to the soil uniformly. Transplant the seedlings in line by keeping the row to row spacing at 25 cm and plant to plant spacing at 10 cm.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: District Advisory

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per extended range forecast of IMD, rainfall is above normal, maximum and minimum temperature is expected to be normal for Odisha during 11.02.2024 to 17.02.2024. Farmers are advised to start sowing (nursery) for summer vegetable cultivation. Spraying operations should be done during upcoming 3-4 days because there is a chance of occurrence of light rainfall in some places is expected at the end of this week.

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: As per extended range forecast of IMD, rainfall is above normal, maximum and minimum temperature is expected to be normal for Odisha during 11.02.2024 to 17.02.2024. Farmers are advised to start sowing (nursery) for summer vegetable cultivation. Spraying operations should be done during upcoming 3-4 days because there is a chance of occurrence of light rainfall in some places is expected at the end of this week.

Agromet_Advisories.Advisory: Yellow mosaic virus attack symptoms is observed in some farmers field so to control this insect spraying of Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 40 g/acre in 200-250 liters of water should be advised under clear sky.

To control aphid and mustard sawfly attack in mustard crop, spraying of Imidacloprid @ 0.3 ml or Thiamethoxam @ 0.3 g and Chloropyriphos @ 2 ml per liter of water respectively should be advised under clear weather condition.

Sowing of Sesame crop should be advised with a seed rate @ 2-2.5 kg seeds per acre. Before sowing, seed treatment should be done with 2g Carbendazim (Bavistin) and due to small seed size it should be mixed with dry sand during sowing in line.
Spraying of Imazethapyr @ 3 ml/liter of water should be advised within 15 days old crop.

To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer/shoot and fruit borer in Tomato and Brinjal, spraying of Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter of water should be advised under clear weather condition. If white fly attack is observed in case Tomato and Brinjal, spraying of Thiamethoxam @ 0.3 g per liter of water should be advised under clear weather condition.

Farmers should start sowing of tomato seed for summer cultivation in nursery bed because prevailing temperature suitable for germination of seed. One hoeing and weeding operation should be advised in case of crop having vegetative growth stage.

Farmers are advised to keep the animal shed clean and dry to avoid disease and insect attack and also provide mineral mixture, jaggery etc. along with fresh clean drinking water to the animal in their daily ration to make them healthy.

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Continued rainfall expected with cloudy weather

Rice.Advisory: Ensure proper drainage in paddy fields to prevent waterlogging

Maize.Advisory: Apply appropriate fertilizers for good crop growth

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Weather forecasting services

Institution.India Meteorological Department: Odisha University of Agriculture and Technology Ranital, Bhadrak, - 756111

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Given by Met.Centre,IMD,Bhubaneswar

Rice.Advisory: General Advisory - As per Medium range weather forecast of IMD, Dry weather for 5 days forecasted so Farmers are advised to give necessary irrigation to field & vegetable crops. Utilising the available water (Rainfall/Irrigation) puddle the land & complete the transplanting of summer rice with basal application of 35kg DAP,20 kg MOP &10 kg ZnSO 4 /acre. Inspect the go down &open the doors & windows for sometime for ventilation & need based spraying of Lambda Cyahalothrin 4.9CS@1.5ml/li. of water to minimize the infestation of storage pest.

Blackgram.Advisory: To reduce incidence of Powdery mildew, Anthracnose & Stem rot in blackgram spraying of (Tebuconazole + Sulphur) @500g/acre recommended.

Rapeseed & Mustard.Advisory: The mustard crop is at the flowering stage. The rainfall received during the last week which results in higher humidity and lower temperature might aggravate Aphid, Leaf Webber and Tobacco Caterpillar infestation in mustard crop. To manage these pests at e arly stage of infestation spray Neem -based pesticide (Neem Oil 1500 PPM) @ 600 -ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. After 7 -10 days need based spraying of Emamectin Benzoate @300g/acre is recommended.

Greengram.Advisory: Complete the sowing of summer Greengram as soon as possible to avoid the infestation of sucking pest and viral disease under delayed sowing condition.

Tomato & Brinjal.Advisory: To prevent from wilting or partial wilting in brinjal and tomato apply Neem or Karanjaa cake and spray Tebuconazole fungicide @ 1ml/liter to plant and plant base. Provide bamboo or wooden stake for better fruit set and growth of Tomato plants. For minimizing the infestation of sucking insect pests like white fly, leaf hopper,thirps and aphid in vegetables nursery and main field, spray Thiamethoxam @ 0.4g/litre of water or Difenthurian @1g/li Of water. To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer in winter vegetables like Brinjal, Cole crops, Chilly & tomato apply 0.5 g Emamectin benzoate or Spinosad 0.4 ml/ liter of water.

Cucurbits.Advisory: Sowing of Recommended HYV/Hybrid of Cucurbits after treating the seeds with Imidachloprid 600FS@(8 -10)ml/kg seeds to minimize the incidence of viral /phytoplasma incidence.

Flower.Advisory: Spray the Marigold plant with Difenthurion @1g/l Of water or Abamectin @0.75ml/l Of water to control the infestation of Thrips,Aphids,Mites and Leaf Minor. For spraying of incidence of leaf spot & Blight spraying of (Carbendazim+Mancozeb) recommended.

Pisciculture.Advisory: As the winter is in the starting phase, there is a possibility of “EUS” disease in fish. Farmers are advised to apply „Cifax‟ @ 400 ml mixed with 40 litre of water in one acre pond area as a preventive measure. The fishes should be fed daily with oil cake bran mixture at the rate of 2 -3 % of their total biomass.

Animal Science.Advisory: Animals should be given mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery etc. may be provided @ 10% -20% in the daily ration during winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals .

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits &Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio -Fertilizer, Bio -Pesticides, Vermi& VermiCompost and Farm Implements

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: Start sowing for summer vegetable cultivation. Spray operations advised due to expected rainfall.

Control aphid and mustard sawfly attack through specific spraying
Sowing and seed treatment advice for Sesame crop
Specific spraying advice for Groundnut crop
Specific spraying advice for Tomato, Brinjal, Chilli crop

Institution.Location: Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology, Regional Research & Technology Transfer Sub Station, Kirei, Sundergarh -770073

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per IMD Forecast, the district may likely receive no rainfall for the next five days. The sky condition may be clear sky to partly cloudy for the next five days. The wind speed is likely to remain within 5-8km/h. The Maximum Temperature and Minimum Temperature will likely remain between 27-31C and 12-16C respectively for the next five days.

DEO GARH.Advisory: Due to low temperature, apply thin layer of dry FYM on nursery to maintain the temperature. Start sowing the summer crops when the temperature is conducive for germination.

National crops of pulses with high yield in dry season are: - Mung varieties IPM -02-14 (65 days), IPM -02-3 (65 days), PDM -11 (65 days), PDM -54 (60 to 65 days). Durga (60 to 65 days), Samrat (65 to 70 days), K -851 (60 to 65 days) and pear varieties – Sarla (65 to 70 days), PU -31 (70 days), PU -30 (65 to 70 days), PU -35 (65 to 70 days), PU -19 (65 to 70 days) etc. collect and sow in the land 25 kg of seeds (500 gm are required per hectare.

Apply light irrigation in the nursery. Keep standing water in the paddy nursery 15 days onwards of sowing. At 15 days apply 4 kg urea for proper vigor of seedlings. Finish the nursery preparation work at the end of January month. For this, use light and medium varieties of seeds. At the time of last cultivation, 40 baskets of cow dung manure, 12 kg Single Super Phosphate and 02 kg of muriate of potash fertilizer to the soil.

Prepare the paddy nursery and transplant the 10 -12 days old seedlings on the main field. Applying 200 grams of mustard oil or til oil per quintal to mung blackgram reduces the risk of moth infestation.

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per IMD forecast, the Dhenkanal district is likely to have cloudy sky. The wind speed is likely to remain between 06-08 km/h. The maximum temperature is likely to remain between 29-34 °C and minimum temperature between 17-20°C. The maximum RH will remain between 16% to 37% for the next five days.

General Advisory: Farmers are advised to irrigate their field as there is mildly dry condition prevailed.
Rabi season crop needs 10- 15 irrigations at 7-10 days interval depending upon the soil moisture condition.
Groundnut crop is flowering stage apply Gypsum 200 kg per acre.
In onion crop, go for inter culture and hand weeding at 15-20 DAT. Apply 30kg of urea and 15 kg of MOP fertilizer at this stage.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: For better agricultural benefits use, OUAT KALINGA products (Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio-Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements).

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Dry weather with a partly cloudy sky. Wind speed: 6-11 km/hr. Max Temp: 29.0-30.0°C. Min Temp: 19.0-20.0°C. Max RH: 87%. Min RH: 39%

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: Mulch vegetable seedlings with straw or other mulching material to avoid cold injury.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Rain is not expected in the coming five days.

GROUNDNUT.Advisory: Farmers are advised to do intercultivation and apply Gypsum @200 kg/acre in Groundnut which is at the flowering stage. To manage leaf miner spray Neem Based Pesticide (Azadirachtin) 300 PPM @ 1-litre /acre during the primary stage of infestation. To manage chemically spray Profenophos 50% EC @ 400 ml/acre or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5 % E.C @ 400 ml/acre by mixing it in 200 -litre of water.

CLUSTER BEAN/GUARD.Advisory: Die back has been observed in some places to control spray azoxystrobin + tebuconazole 15 ml mix in 15 lt of water.

BRINJAL.Advisory: During the primary stage of the shoot and fruit borer infestation in Brinjal spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

COWPEA/LOBIA.Advisory: Downy mildew in beans has been observed in some places, For chemical management spray 30 gm of Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64% with Thiamethoxam 3 gm in 14 lt of water.

GOAT.Advisory: This time goats and sheep are more prone to PPR, Cold, and Fever, so it is necessary to complete vaccination.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: OUAT_KALINGA_Products

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Dry with clear to mainly clear sky

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: Seedling treatment with 0.2% Chloropyriphos for 10-12 hours to control stemborer in the main field if granular insecticides have not been applied previously in the nursery. Keep bunding water in the main field of rice under late transplanting. Plan for irrigation to summer paddy and other crops observing soil moisture. Carry on intercultural operation, fertilizer, and weedicide application. Continue harvesting matured crops and keep the products in a safe place to protect them from rain. Spray insecticides or pesticides in crops as per requirement.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Apply the insecticides in the afternoon hours so that the movement of Honeybees will not be disturbed. Always use flat-fan or flood-jet nozzle and clean water for herbicide spraying.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seeds, Fertilizers, Pesticides

The maximum temperature and minimum temperature will likely to remain 30-33°C and 18-20°C respectively for the next five days.

Agromet_Advisory.Rice: General Advisory - As per Medium range weather forecast of IMD, chances of dry weather for 5 days forecasted so Farmers are advised to give necessary irrigation to field & vegetable crops. Utilising the available water (Rainfall/Irrigation) puddle the land & complete the transplanting of summer rice with basal application of 35kg DAP,20 kg MOP &10 kg ZnSO 4 /acre. Forecast_Up_To.Description: Dry weather may prevail over the district of Jagatsinghpur. The sky condition may remain clear to partly cloudy for the next five days. Wind speed will remain within 12-15 km/h. Daily maximum and minimum temperature are likely to remain 28-30°C and 19-22°C respectively for next five days.

Agromet Advisory.Advisory: Complete the transplanting of 3-5 week old seedlings in well-puddled soil at a spacing of 15cm × 15cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at shallow depth.
In bacterial blight endemic areas, dip the seedling roots in 0.1% (1g in one litre of water) Plantomyc in solution before transplanting for 30 minutes.
Seedling treatment with 0.2% Chloropyriphos for 10-12 hours to control stemborer in the main field if granular insecticides have not been applied previously in the nursery.
Apply (DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg) or (Urea 22 kg + SSP 125 kg + MOP 22 kg) as basal dose during final puddling.
Farmers those have already completed transplanting, apply granular herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl + Pretilachlor @ 4kg/acre at 5-8 days after transplanting.
In just transplanted field put 3 pheromone traps with 5mg lure/acre in the rice field for monitoring of the yellow stem borer and leaf folder.
Rabi crop needs 10-15 irrigations at 7-10 days interval depending upon the soil moisture condition.

Sugarcane crop is a heavy feeder. Apply 87-kg of DAP, 20-kg of MOP and 4-tonne of FYM at the time of planting in trenches. Top dressing with Urea @ 60-kg per acre each at 45, 75 and 105 days after planting should be done.
To manage early and late leaf blight in tomato, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600 gram/acre or Zineb 75% WP @ 500 gram/acre at 7 days interval.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio-Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Dry weather may prevail over the district Kendrapara. The sky condition may remain clear to partly cloudy. Wind speed will be within 08-13 km/h. Daily maximum temperature likely to be 30-32°C and minimum 19-22°C.

Transplanting.Advisory: Complete the transplanting of 3-5 week old seedlings in well puddled soil at a spacing of 15cm × 15cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at shallow depth.
In bacterial blight endemic areas, dip the seedling roots in 0.1% (1g in one litre of water) Plantomyc in solution before transplanting for 30 minutes.

Apply (DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg) or (Urea 22 kg + SSP 125 kg + MOP 22 kg) as basal dose during final puddling.

In just transplanted field put 3 pheromone traps with 5mg lure/acre in the rice field for monitoring of the yellow stem borer and leaf folder.
Rabi crop needs 10-15 irrigations at 7-10 days interval depending upon the soil moisture condition.

Sugarcane crop is a heavy feeder. Apply 87-kg of DAP, 20-kg of MOP and 4-tonne of FYM at the time of planting in trenches. Top dressing with Urea @ 60-kg per acre each at 45, 75 and 105 days after planting should be done.
To manage early and late leaf blight in tomato, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600 gram/acre or Zineb 75% WP @ 500 gram/acre at 7 days interval.

Institution.Location: RRTTS, G. UDAYAGIRI, OUAT, KANDHAMAL, ODISHA -762100

Forecast_Up_To.Description: The district is likely to receive no rainfall with mainly clear to partly cloudy sky. Maximum temperature and minimum temperature will remain between 27-33°C and 11-14°C respectively.

General.Advisory: The sky will remain clear for the next five days and temperature will be increased with respect to the previous week.
Farmers are advised to harvesting of the matured crops and after that they can Sun-dry the harvested crops.

Chilli.Advisory: To control aphids and thrips in chilli during primary stage of pest infestation spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

Turmeric.Advisory: Raw turmeric is processed after 2-3 days after harvesting. Store the fingers under the shade or covered in saw/coir dust.

Green_gram.Advisory: To control powdery mildew disease in Green-gram crop spray Sulphur 80% WP @800-gram/acre or Hexaconazole 5% E.C @ 300 ml/acre.

Rice.Advisory: In Zinc deficient soil apply Zinc Sulphate (21%) @ 10 kg/acre at every three years.

Garden_Pea.Advisory: Provide lifesaving irrigation to the developing plants otherwise plant will dry up and yellowed. If Pod borer infestation is seen, then apply the following. Spray Azadirachtin 0.03% (300ppm) thrice at fortnightly intervals.

Brinjal.Advisory: During primary stage of whitefly infestation spray neem-based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water. To manage this pest chemically spray Thiamethoxam 25 % WG @ 40-gram/acre or Pyriproxyfen 10% EC @ 200-ml/acre or Spiromesifen 22.9% SC @ 250-ml/acre by mixing in 200-liter of water.

Tomato.Advisory: If fruit borer infestation prevails, Spray any one of the insecticides Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% S.C @ 80 ml/acre or Flubendiamide 39.5 % M/M S.C @ 40 ml/acre or Indoxacarb 14.5% S.C. @ 200 ml/acre. Use pheromone trap 20@acre.

Marigold.Advisory: In cloudy weather event, there is a chance of occurrence of powdery mildew in marigold. To control this, apply Sulfex @3gm/liter of water after rain fall stops.

Poultry.Advisory: If chicks are congregated at one place, then provision for more warmth should be done. Close the open spaces in night and early morning to protect them winter. If any disease arises, isolate the affected one and vaccinate the others.

Fisheries.Advisory: In winter there is common white spots are found in fishes called as EUS. These spots later on turned into wounds which led to mortality of fishes. To prevent this, apply Aquaneem @ 1lt/ha or CIFAX @ 1lt/ha.

Cattle.Advisory: High amount of food is required in winter for cattle to maintain the metabolic activities and milk production. Maize, wheat and concentrate oil cakes @ 3 kg to the large animals such as Buffalo and cattle feeding helps in maintaining the body heat.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedling, Sampling & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits and Vegetables, Value added products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom and Spawns, Bio-fertilizers, Bio-pesticides, Vermi & Vermi Compost

Institution.Gramin Krishi Mausam Sewa: India Meteorological Department, AMFU Semiliguda, Odisha University of Agriculture & Technology Regional Research & Technology Transfer Station Semiliguda, Post Box No: 10, Sunabeda, Koraput -763002

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Chances of mainly clear sky during next five days. Chances of no rainfall during next five days. Maximum temperature is expected to be 27-30°C and minimum temperature is expected to be 11-14°C. Maximum and minimum relative humidity is expected to be 62-92%, and 22-28%, respectively.

General.Advisory: Apply light irrigation to the nursery beds twice a week. The rice seedlings at 4 -5 leaf stage are ready for transplanting.
Blast in rice nursery may observe, to control it spray the nursery area with Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.
For transplanted rice apply 4.5 kg urea, 44 kg DAP and 22 kg MoP per acre as basal dose during final puddling.
Fall army worm may observe in rabi maize field, to control it spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/litre of water.

Complete the sowing of summer maize within 1st week of February at a spacing of 60 cm x 20 cm with seed rate of 6 kg/acre. Apply of 52 kg DAP and 40 kg MoP per acre as basal dose. To control weeds spray Atrazine 50% WP @ 800 g/acre with 200 litres of water within 3 days after sowing.
Chances of tobacco caterpillar infestation in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.
Collar rot and stem rot may observe in rabi groundnut, to control...

Institution.Name: REGIONAL RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY TRANSFER STATION, KENDUJHAR

Forecast_Up_To.Description: There is likely to be no rainfall during the next five days. The wind speed may remain within 5-8 kmph. The maximum and minimum temperature will remain within 25-31 0C and 12-15 0C during the next five days.

General_advisory: Provide irrigation if soil moisture stress is observed.
Harvest the matured crops and store them in safe storage.
Use Aluminium Phosphide (Celphos tablets) as fumigants for safe storage.
Carefully, monitor the field for disease and pests.

Advisory: Top dressing of Urea in pre-flowering stage of Linseed can be applied.
Spraying of Imidachloprid @ 2 g/lt of water can reduce the aphids population.
Use Chloropyriphos and neem extract containing Azadiractin 300 ppm can reduce the damage by Termite and leaf miner.
Avoid excessive irrigation to the crop.
Powdery mildew can be managed using home remedy by spraying milk sprays (40% milk and 60% water).
To control powdery mildew disease in chickpea spray with Dithane-M 45 @ 2.5 g/lt of water.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio-Pesticides, Vermi & Vermi Compost and Farm Implements

Institution.Name: India Meteorological Department
Institution.Region: Region al Research & Technology Transfer Station (RRTTS)

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Dry weather is very likely to prevail in coming four days and light rain may befall on Sunday. Sky may remain clear to partly cloudy and wind may blow mainly from Easterly to South Westerly direction with the speed of 006 to 008 km/hr. The maximum and minimum temperature may remain 29 to 35 0C and 17 to 20 0C respectively. Maximum RH is expected to vary between 59 – 82 % and minimum RH between 16 – 24 %.

General_Advisory: Always apply recommended dose of fertilizers according to the soil test report and recommended dose of pesticide in correct method during morning or evening hours and pay attention to the wind direction during application.
Farmers are advised to install “T” shaped bird perches in and around crop field like Chickpea, Green gram, Groundnut and vegetables for controlling insect population.
Install pheromone trap @ 3 -4/acre for monitoring borer insect in vegetables like brinjal, cauliflower, cabbage, tomato etc
To control black spot disease in Rose spray Copper Oxy-chloride 50% WP @ 3g/ltr of water.
To control inflorescence rotting in Merigold spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 2g or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1g by mixing with one liter of water.
Vaccinate animals against FMD, BQ, HS, PPR & Goat Pox.

Advisory: Prepare the main field for timely transplanting. Apply DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg per acre as basal dose during final puddling.
Transplant 3–4-week-old seedlings in well puddled soil at a spacing of 15 cm ×15 cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at shallow depth.
In bacterial blight endemic areas, dip the seedling roots in 0.1% Plantomycin solution before transplanting for 30 minutes.

Apply granular herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl + Pretiachlor @ 4 kg/acre at 5-8 days after transplanting by mixing with equal quantity of sand and broadcast it uniformly in the field or spray Pyrazosulfuron-ethyl 10 WP @ 5 g/10 ltrs of water at 3-5 days after transplanting.
Weed Management: Apply Imazethapyr 10% SL @ 3ml/10 ltrs of water or Imazethapyr 35% + Imazamox 35% SL @ 1ml/5 ltrs of water at 15-20 DAS.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio-Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per the forecast received from IMD, dry weather may prevail over the district of Khordha for next five days. The sky condition may remain mainly clear to partly cloudy for the next five days. In the next 5 days, the wind speed will remain within 08-11 km/h. The daily maximum and minimum temperature are likely to remain 30-34°C and 19-21°C respectively for next five days

Transplanting.Advisory: Complete the transplanting of 3-5 week old seedlings in well puddled soil at a spacing of 15cm × 15cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at shallow depth.
Dip the seedling roots in 0.1% (1g in one litre of water) Plantomycin solution before transplanting for 30 minutes.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: For better agricultural benefits use, OUAT KALINGA products (Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio-Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements).

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Chances of clear to mainly clear sky during next five days. Chances of no rainfall during next five days. Maximum temperature is expected to be 32-35°C and minimum temperature is expected to be 18-20°C. Maximum and minimum relative humidity is expected to be 63-84%, and 21-26%, respectively.

General.Advisory: No rainfall and dry weather expected during next five days. So, go for irrigation in crop field as per requirement.
Farmers are advised for not to burn the residue of kharif crops in the fields because it not only pollute the environment but also causes the severe health problems.

Rice.Advisory: Apply light irrigation to the nursery beds twice a week. The rice seedlings at 4 -5 leaf stage are ready for transplanting.
Blast in rice nursery may observe, to control it spray the nursery area with Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.
For transplanted rice apply 4.5 kg urea, 44 kg DAP and 22 kg MoP per acre as basal dose during final puddling.

Maize.Advisory: Fall army worm may observe in rabi maize field, to control it spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/litre of water.

Complete the sowing of summer maize within 1st week of February at a spacing of 60 cm x 20 cm with seed rate of 6 kg/acre. Apply of 52 kg DAP and 40 kg MoP per acre as basal dose. To control weeds spray Atrazine 50% WP @ 800 g/acre with 200 litres of water within 3 days after sowing.

Groundnut.Advisory: Chances of tobacco caterpillar infestation in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.
Collar rot and stem rot may observe in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Metalaxyl 8% + Mancozeb 64%WP @ 2 g/litre of water or Carbendazim 50% WP @ 1.5 g/litre of water to the base of the plant.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits &Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio -Pesticides, Vermi & Vermi Compost and Farm Implements

Forecast_Up_To.Description: The district is likely to remain dry with clear to generally cloudy sky. The wind speed will remain within 7.0 to 8.0 kmph up to next five days. The daily maximum temperature may range between 28.0°C to 32.0°C. The minimum temperature may rise between 12.0°C to 14.0°C.

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: Apply frequent light irrigation to summer paddy seedlings in nursery if required. Covering the vegetable crops with polythene that must not have a hole, in a way that the polysheet will not touch the crop. Remove the cover in day time. In the event of fog in some places, possible crop damage may occur. Farmers can go for harvest the matured crops. Apply dry cow dung manure in the base to keep the soil warm, as the night temperature is low. Farmers can do weeding & earthing up operations. High humid conditions favour the increase of diseases & pests. Farmers can take plant protection measures. Apply the insecticides in the afternoon hours so that the movement of Honeybees will not be disturbed. Always use flat-fan or flood-jet nozzle and clean water for herbicide spraying.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Seedling treatment with 0.2% Chloropyriphos for 10-12 hours to control stemborer in the main field if granular insecticides have not been applied previously in the nursery.

Crop_Specific_Advisory.Specific_Advisory: Farmers those who are going for transplanting should apply 35- kg DAP, 30- kg MOP and 8-kg Urea per acre during last puddling. For sandy soil apply 35 kg DAP, 15 kg MOP and 8 kg Urea per acre during last puddling. In Zinc deficient soil apply Zinc Sulphate (21%) @ 10 kg/acre at every three years. Transplanting of 25-30 days old seedlings should be done at a spacing of 20 x15 cm, plant 2-3 seedlings per hill for high yielding varieties.

To prevent whitefly infestation seeds should be treated with Imidacloprid @ 7-gram/kg of seeds before sowing. Install 8-10 nos of yellow sticky traps starting from 2-3 leaf stage of the crop. Diseased plants should be rogued out to prevent further spread of the disease. To manage whitefly infestation at early stage of crop spray Neem based pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water. If the infestation is severe than go for chemical pesticide like Thiamethoxam @ 40-gram/acre or Acetamiprid @ 50-gram/acre by mixing in 200-litre of water.

The present weather condition with high day temperature and low night temperature is congenial for aphids and thrips infestation in groundnut. To manage aphids, and thrips spray Neem Based Pesticide 300 PPM @ 1-litre /acre during primary stage of infestation. If the infestation is severe than spray Thiomethoxam 25% W.G @ 40 gram/acre or Imidacloprid 17.8% SL @ 50-ml/acre by mixing it in 200 litre of water.

The rainfall during the previous week which results in higher humidity and lower temperature might aggravate Downy Mildew in Mustard. High relative humidity also might aggravate white rust. After rain, to manage Downy Mildew & white rust chemically spray 3.5 ml Metalaxyl-M 31.8% ES or 2.5g Metalaxyl M 4 % + Mancozeb 64 % WP per litre of water. There are chances of Leaf Webber and Mustard sawfly infestation in mustard crop. To manage Mustard sawfly and leaf Webber spray Ethofenprox 10 % EC @ 200-ml/acre or Chlorpyriphos 50% + Cypermethrin 5 % E.C @ 400 ml/acre by mixing it in 200 litre of water. There are chances of aphid and painted bug infestation in mustard crop. During primary stage of infestation of Aphid and Painted Bug, spray Neem Based Pesticide 1500 PPM @ 600-ml/acre. To manage Aphids and Painted Bug chemically spray Thiomethoxam 25% W. G @ 40 gram/acre or Acetamiprid 20% S.P. @ 50 gr...acre or Imidachloprid 17.8% SL @ 60-ml acre by mixing in 200 litres of water. Apply the insecticides in the afternoon hours so that the movement of Honeybees will not be disturbed.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: https://www.ouat.ac.in/

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per IMD forecast, no rainfall is expected for next 5 days and the weather will be sunny and dry. Maximum temperature will vary from 31°C- 34°C and minimum temperature will vary from 18°C to 20°C. The range of maximum humidity may remain 58%-95% and minimum humidity may remain 19%-37%. Cloud cover will be 1-5 octa. Wind speed may vary within 6 kmph.

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: Dry weather is likely to prevail in the district.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Dry weather is likely to prevail in the district.

PIGEON PEA (RED GRAM/ARHAR).Advisory: In order to control leaf blight in pigeon pea, spray Chlorothalonil @ 400 g in 200 litres of water per acre of land.
Pod borer in pigeon pea cultivation has been noticed in some places. Spray Chlorantraniliprole @ 80 ml in 200 litres of water per acre of land to control it.

GREEN GRAM.Advisory: Treat the green gram seeds with Vitavax power (Carboxyn + Thiram) @ 2 gm or Gaucho (Imidachloprid 600 FS) @ 5 ml per kg of seeds before sowing in the main field.

Horticulture_Specific_Advisory.Advisory: Wilting has been noticed in brinjal. Soil drench with Copper oxychloride 50Horticulture (Stage) Specific Advisory WP @ 2 gm + Streptocyclin @ 0.1 gm per liter of water to control it.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Unutilised small pieces of paddy straw can be used in oyster mushroom production so that cost of cultivation as well as manual work can be reduced.

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Chances of clear to mainly clear sky during next five days. Chances of no rainfall during next five days. Maximum temperature is expected to be 29-33°C and minimum temperature is expected to be 12-15°C. Maximum and minimum relative humidity is expected to be 44-73%, and 18-29%, respectively.

General: No rainfall and dry weather expected during next five days. So, go for irrigation in crop field as per requirement.
Farmers are advised for not to burn the residue of kharif crops in the fields because it not only pollute the environment but also causes the severe health problems.

Advisory: Apply light irrigation to the nursery beds twice a week. The rice seedlings at 4 -5 leaf stage are ready for transplanting.
Blast in rice nursery may observe, to control it spray the nursery area with Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG @ 0.4 g/litre of water.
For transplanted rice apply 4.5 kg urea, 44 kg DAP and 22 kg MoP per acre as basal dose during final puddling.
Fall army worm may observe in rabi maize field, to control it spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG @ 0.4 g/litre of water or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 0.4 ml/litre of water.

Complete the sowing of summer maize within 1st week of February at a spacing of 60 cm x 20 cm with seed rate of 6 kg/acre. Apply of 52 kg DAP and 40 kg MoP per acre as basal dose. To control weeds spray Atrazine 50% WP @ 800 g/acre with 200 litres of water within 3 days after sowing.
Chances of tobacco caterpillar infestation in rabi groundnut, to control it spray Thiamethoxam 12.6% + Lambda -Cyhalothrin 9.5% ZC @ 0.3 ml/litre of water or Profenophos 50% EC @ 2 ml/litre of water.

Go for land preparation and sowing of summer groundnut at a spacing of 25 cm x 10 cm with seed rate of 50 kg/acre. Before sowing seed should be treated with 10 g Trichoderma harzianum/viride or 3 g Carboxin 37.5% + Thiram 37.5% DS for one kg seed.

Bulletin_Details.District: Puri (East and South-Eastern Coastal Plain Agroclimatic Zon e)

Forecast_Up_To.Description: District Puri - dry weather may prevail for next five days. Clear sky condition. Wind speed within 11-16 km/h. Max temp: 30-32°C, Min temp: 19-24°C

Agromet Advisory.Advisory: Complete the transplanting of 3-5 week old seedlings in well puddled soil at a spacing of 15cm × 15cm with 3-4 seedlings per hill at shallow depth.
In bacterial blight endemic areas, dip the seedling roots in 0.1% (1g in one litre of water) Plantomyc in solution before transplanting for 30 minutes.
Seedling treatment with 0.2% Chloropyriphos for 10-12 hours to control stemborer in the main field if granular insecticides have not been applied previously in the nursery.
Apply (DAP 44 kg + MOP 22 kg) or (Urea 22 kg + SSP 125 kg + MOP 22 kg) as basal dose during final puddling.
Farmers those have already completed transplanting, apply granular herbicide Bensulfuron-methyl + Pretilachlor @ 4kg/ acre at 5-8 days after transplanting.
In just transplanted field put 3 pheromone traps with 5mg lure/acre in the rice field for monitoring of the yellow stem borer and leaf folder.
Rabi crop needs 10-15 irrigations at 7-10 days interval depending upon the soil moisture condition.

Sugarcane crop is a heavy feeder. Apply 87-kg of DAP, 20-kg of MOP and 4-tonne of FYM at the time of planting in trenches. Top dressing with Urea @ 60-kg per acre each at 45, 75 and 105 days after planting should be done.
To manage early and late leaf blight in tomato, spray Mancozeb 75% WP @ 600 gram/acre or Zineb 75% WP @ 500gram/acre at 7 days interval.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: For better agricultural benefits use, OUAT KALINGA products (Seedlings, Saplings & QPM, Tissue Culture Plants, Fruits & Vegetables, Value Added Products, Fingerlings/ Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushroom & Spawn, Bio-Fertilizer, Bio- Pesticides, Vermi & VermiCompost and Farm Implements).

Forecast_Up_To.Date: Valid Till 08:30 IST of the next 5 days
Forecast_Up_To.Description: It is likely to be clear sky for next four days and partly cloudy sky on sunday . The daily maximum temperature will remain 28.0 °C-33.0°C. The daily minimum temperature will remain 14.0°C-16.0°C. The wind speed will remain 6.0-7.0 kmph. Humid conditions during the forenoon (64-95%) and during the afternoon (18-24%) may prevail.

Agromet_Advisory.General_Advisory: If the nutrient deficiency symptoms (yellowing) and browning of leaf tips appear in rice nursery , apply foliar spray of mixed solution of 0.5% zinc sulphate + 2.5 % urea.
Agromet_Advisory.SMS_Advisory: Cover the recently planted vegetable crops with paper pockets during night time to protect from low temperature.

Crop_Specific_Advisory.Advisory: If the nutrient deficiency symptoms (yellowing) and browning of leaf tips appear in rice nursery , apply foliar spray of mixed solution of 0.5% zinc sulphate + 2.5 % urea.

To avoid storage pests’ infestation during storage smearing of seeds should be done with edible oil @ 250 ml/ Quintal of seeds. Dried leaves of either Begonia or Neem @ 1 kg/Bag should be kept inside the storage bag to minimize storage pest load. Camphor tablets @ 1-tablet/kg of seeds can also be kept inside the storage bag to avoid storage pests.

Onion Seedlings of 8-weeks old which are 12-15 cm in height should be planted in the main field. Before transplanting apply 10 tonnes of Compost, 52 kg of DAP , 30 kg of Muriate of Potash 20 kg of urea and 20 kg of sulphur and mix it to the soil uniformly . Transplant the seedlings in line by keeping the row to row spacing at 25 cm and plant to plant spacing at 10 cm.

Meghdoot_Mobile_App.Description: Meghdoot Mobile App for weather updates

Institution.India Meteorological Department: Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology

Forecast_Up_To.Description: There is very less chance of occurrence of rainfall in upcoming 3 days. Light rainfall along with partly to generally cloudy sky is expected at the end of this week.

General Advisory.Advisory: Rainfall is above normal. Start sowing for summer vegetable cultivation. Spray operations should be done during upcoming 3-4 days.

Green Gram/Black Gram.Advisory: Yellow mosaic virus attack symptoms are observed. Control by spraying Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 40 g/acre in 200-250 liters of water.

Mustard.Advisory: To control aphid and mustard sawfly attack, spray Imidacloprid @ 0.3 ml or Thiamethoxam @ 0.3 g and Chloropyriphos @ 2 ml per liter of water respectively under clear weather condition.

Sesame.Advisory: Sow Sesame crop with seed rate @ 2-2.5 kg seeds per acre. Treat seeds with 2g Carbendazim (Bavistin) before sowing.

Groundnut.Advisory: Spray Imazethapyr @ 3 ml/liter of water within 15 days old crop.

Tomato, Brinjal, Chilli.Advisory: To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer, spray Emamectin Benzoate @ 0.4 g per liter of water under clear weather condition. If white fly attack is observed, spray Thiamethoxam @ 0.3 g per liter of water.

Tomato.Advisory: Start sowing of tomato seeds for summer cultivation in nursery bed. Hoeing and weeding operation should be advised.

Animal Husbandry.Advisory: Keep animal shed clean and dry. Provide mineral mixture, jaggery, and clean drinking water to animals daily.

Institution.OUAT: Orissa University of Agriculture and Technology

Forecast_Up_To.Description: Light rainfall expected at the end of the week

General_Advisory: Farmers are advised to start sowing (nursery) for summer vegetable cultivation.
Spraying operations should be done during upcoming 3-4 days due to expected light rainfall.

Agromet_Advisories: Yellow mosaic virus attack symptoms observed in some farmers field.
Spraying of Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 40 g/acre in 200-250 liters of water advised.
To control aphid and mustard sawfly attack, spraying of Imidacloprid or Thiamethoxam and Chloropyriphos advised.
Sowing of Sesame crop advised with seed rate @ 2-2.5 kg seeds per acre.
Spraying of Imazethapyr @ 3 ml/liter of water advised within 15 days old crop.
To control leaf eating caterpillar and fruit borer, spraying of Emamectin Benzoate advised.
If white fly attack is observed, spraying of Thiamethoxam advised.
Farmers should start sowing of tomato seed for summer cultivation.
One hoeing and weeding operation should be advised in case of crop having vegetative growth stage.

Animal_Husbandry.Advisory: Farmers are advised to keep the animal shed clean and dry to avoid disease and insect attack. Provide mineral mixture, jaggery etc., along with fresh clean drinking water to the animal.

Forecast_Up_To.Description: As per IMD Forecast, the district is likely to receive light rainfall for the next five days. The sky condition is mainly clear sky to generally cloudy for the next five days. The wind speed is likely to remain within 6-9 km/h. The Maximum Temperature and Minimum Temperature is forecasted to remain between 28-32°C and 14-16°C respectively for the next five days.

Sundargarh.Advisory: Due to low temperature, apply thin layer of dry FYM on nursery to maintain the temperature. Start sowing the summer crops when the temperature is conducive for germination.

National crops of pulses with high yield in dry season are: - Mung varieties IPM-02-14 (65 days), IPM-02-3 (65 days), PDM-11 (65 days), PDM-54 (60 to 65 days), Durga (60 to 65 days), Samrat (65 to 70 days), K-851 (60 to 65 days) and Blackgram varieties – Sarla (65 to 70 days), PU-31 (70 days), PU-30 (65 to 70 days), PU-35 (65 to 70 days), PU-19 (65 to 70 days) etc. collect and sow in the land 25 kg of seeds are required per hectare. Before sowing treat the seeds with Carbendazim @ 2 g/kg of seeds seven days before sowing. In the previous night of sowing, treat the seeds with rhizobium culture @ 20g per kg of seeds. Sow it in the spacing of 25cm X 10 cm spacing.

Apply light irrigation in the nursery. Keep standing water in the paddy nursery 15 days onwards of sowing. At 15 days apply 4 kg urea for proper vigor of seedlings. Finish the nursery preparation work at the end of January month. For this, use light and medium varieties of seeds. At the time of last cultivation, 40 baskets of cow dung manure, 12 kg Single Super Phosphate and 02 kg of muriate of potash fertilizer to the soil. SRI Paddy: Prepare the paddy nursery and transplant the 10-12 days old seedling on the main field.

Additional_Resources.OUAT_KALINGA_Products: Seedlings, Saplings and QPM, Tissue culture plants, Fruits and vegetables, value added products, Fingerlings/Yearlings, Poultry chicks, Breeds, Mushrooma and spawn, Biofertilizer, Biopesticides, Vermi & Vermicompost and Farm implements
